title: P22 and the International House of Fonts introduce 4 new fonts from 4 IHOF
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160924/http:/typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 1.Sep.2005 8.33am 

——————————————-  
For Immediate Release:  
Buffalo, NY September 1st, 2005  
——————————————-

Monumental Titling: Michael Clark (USA)  
P22 Monumental Titling is based on classic Roman proportions and drawn from  
a calligraphic hand. This tasteful and well crafted Humanist display face  
exudes an air of dignity along with subtle playfulness. Alternate  
letterforms and ligatures give this capitals-only font expanded  
possibilities for any given text.

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/monumental.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160924/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/monumental.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/monumental.html")

Komusubi: Hajime Kawakame (JAPAN)  
P22 Komusubi is a new font family from Hajime Kawakami. It features Latin  
as well as Katakana and Hiragana. This lively display font comes in regular  
and bold for all three alphabets. In Japanese, Komusubi means to tie a  
string or ribbon lightly. The Nipponian lyrical atmosphere of the word  
“Komusubi” reflects the casual tone of the font itself.

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/komusubi.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160924/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/komusubi.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/komusubi.html")

Driade: Gabor Kothay (HUNGARY)  
Driade is a group of fonts based on a personal calligraphic expression. It  
is exotic but still familiar, readable and graced with a human touch.  
“Aged” features irregularities found in Kothay’s original brush drawings.  
“Lined” pares the letterforms down to their basic forms.

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/driade.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160924/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/driade.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/driade.html")

Mystic Font: Terry Wudenbachs (LIECHTENSTIEN).  
The P22 Mystic font knows all. Aside from allowing for type design in a  
faux eastern script, this font peers into the world of the spirits for  
guidance and enlightenment. Sure it has small caps and ligatures as  
OpenType features, but it also has a special “oracle” feature which will  
answer your most mystifying questions. The design itself was based on an  
actual Ouija board. Somehow the spirits became embedded into the font  
itself and now when a question is typed, an answer is revealed (provided  
the contextual alternates feature is enabled). It is not known how the  
otherworldly harbinger was able to integrate into OpenType scripting, but  
who are we mere mortals to question this power? Ask and ye shall be  
amazed!

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/mysticfont.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906160924/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/mysticfont.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/mysticfont.html")

Fonts starting at $19.95.

To request additional information or sample images, please reply to this  
message.

Thank you for your support.
